page.title: 15Pig Development Unit
page.content: The Pig Development Unit on the Stotfold - Hitchin road has been operating under that title for a year since opening in 1985. Before that since 1956 it was the Progeny Testing Station. When we went in June 1985 there were 7OO pigs altogether - 235 sows and 4O boars. The oldest pig was 13 months old and the youngest 3 days. The purpose of the Pig Development Unit is to discover the best way of rearing pigs to obtain the best quality meat comparable to the cost of producing it. When piglets are born they weight 1.5 kilos They put on .5 kilo of weight for every kilo of food consumed. When the pigs have ben in the unit for 19 weeks they are slaughtered and made into chops, spare ribs, ham and bacon - everything is used but the squeak.
